Heading: Proprietary
Note: Note that <IDTypeName> is required with proprietary identifiers

Heading: Proprietary
Note: DEPRECATED – use 01

Heading: DNB publisher identifier
Note: Deutsche Nationalbibliothek publisher identifier

Heading: GLN
Note: GS1 global location number (formerly EAN location number)

Heading: SAN
Note: Book trade Standard Address Number – US, UK etc

Heading: MARC organization code
Note: MARC code list for organizations – see http://www.loc.gov/marc/organizations/orgshome.html

Heading: Centraal Boekhuis Relatie ID
Note: Trading party identifier used in the Netherlands

Heading: Fondscode Boekenbank
Note: Flemish publisher code

Heading: Y-tunnus
Note: Business Identity Code (Finland). See http://www.ytj.fi/ (in Finnish)

Heading: ISNI
Note: International Standard Name Identifier. A sixteen digit number. Usually presented with spaces or hyphens dividing the number into four groups of four digits, but in ONIX the spaces or hyphens should be omitted. See http://www.isni.org/

Heading: PND
Note: Personennamendatei – person name authority file used by Deutsche Nationalbibliothek and in other German-speaking countries. See http://www.dnb.de/standardisierung/normdateien/pnd.htm (German) or http://www.dnb.de/eng/standardisierung/normdateien/pnd.htm (English). DEPRECATED in favor of the GND

Heading: LCCN
Note: A control number assigned to a Library of Congress Name Authority record

Heading: Japanese Publisher identifier
Note: Publisher identifier administered by Japanese ISBN Agency

Heading: GKD
Note: Gemeinsame Körperschaftsdatei – Corporate Body Authority File in the German-speaking countries. See http://www.dnb.de/standardisierung/normdateien/gkd.htm (German) or http://www.dnb.de/eng/standardisierung/normdateien/gkd.htm (English). DEPRECATED in favor of the GND

Heading: ORCID
Note: Open Researcher and Contributor ID. A sixteen digit number. Usually presented with hyphens dividing the number into four groups of four digits, but in ONIX the hyphens should be omitted. See http://www.orcid.org/

Heading: GAPP Publisher Identifier
Note: Publisher identifier maintained by the Chinese ISBN Agency (GAPP)

Heading: VAT Identity Number
Note: Identifier for a business organization for VAT purposes, eg within the EU’s VIES system. See http://ec.europa.eu/taxation_customs/vies/faqvies.do for EU VAT ID formats, which vary from country to country. Generally these consist of a two-letter country code followed by the 8–12 digits of the national VAT ID. Some countries include one or two letters within their VAT ID. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VAT_identification_number for non-EU countries that maintain similar identifiers. Spaces, dashes etc should be omitted

Heading: JP Distribution Identifier
Note: 4-digit business organization identifier controlled by the Japanese Publication Wholesalers Association

Heading: GND
Note: Gemeinsame Normdatei – Joint Authority File in the German-speaking countries. See http://www.dnb.de/EN/gnd (English). Combines the PND, SWD and GKD into a single authority file, and should be used in preference

Heading: DUNS
Note: Dunn and Bradstreet Universal Numbering System, see http://www.dnb.co.uk/dandb-duns-number

Heading: Ringgold ID
Note: Ringgold organizational identifier, see http://www.ringgold.com/identify.html

Heading: Identifiant Editeur Electre
Note: French Electre publisher identifier

Heading: EIDR Party DOI
Note: DOI used in EIDR party registry, for example ‘10.5237/C9F6-F41F’ (Sam Raimi). See http://eidr.org

Heading: Identifiant Marque Electre
Note: French Electre imprint Identifier

Heading: VIAF ID
Note: Virtual Internet Authority File. <IDValue> should be a number. The URI form of the identifier can be created by prefixing the number with ‘https://viaf.org/viaf/’. See https://viaf.org

Heading: FundRef DOI
Note: DOI used in CrossRef’s Open Funder Registry list of academic research funding bodies, for example ‘10.13039/100004440’ (Wellcome Trust). See http://www.crossref.org/fundingdata/registry.html

Heading: BNE CN
Note: Control number assigned to a Name Authority record by the Biblioteca Nacional de España

Heading: BNF Control Number
Note: Numéro de la notice de personne BNF

Heading: ARK
Note: Archival Resource Key, as a URL (including the address of the ARK resolver provided by eg a national library)

Heading: Nasjonalt autoritetsregister
Note: Nasjonalt autoritetsregister for navn – Norwegian national authority file for personal and corporate names. For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: GRID
Note: Global Research Identifier Database ID (see https://www.grid.ac). For use in ONIX 3.0 only
